angel-city-fizz.title: Angel City Fizz
ingredients: top with about 3 oz floral IPA

image.alt: Narrow glass filled with a golden cocktail, the top half of which is white froth

angel-city-fizz.content:
Add all ingredients except IPA in a cocktail shaker. Dry shake, then shake again with plenty of ice. Strain into collins glass.

Dump the ice from the shaker and pour in the IPA. Swirl the shaker a little so the IPA froths up a bit. Pour frothy IPA over the drink.

bannon-tantrum.title: Bannon Tantrum

image.alt: A crystal glass with the cocktail in front of a bottle of Dry Fly vodka and a meyer lemon

bannon-tantrum.intro:
“The media should keep its mouth shut and just listen for awhile”—_Steve Bannon throwing a tantrum on Jan 26, 2017_

This must be made with [Dry Fly brand vodka](http://www.dryflydistilling.com/dryfly-product/washington-wheat-vodka/); It has an amazing wheat flavor and I created this recipe specifically to let it shine.
bannon-tantrum.content: Add everything to a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass over ice.

bees-knees.title: Bees Knees
bees-knees.content:
Add gin, lemon juice, and [honey syrup](/ingredients/simple-syrups/#honey-syrup) to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass.

Garnish with lemon twist.

bijou.title: Bijou
bijou.content:
Stir the liquids in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Express the oils from the lemon peel over the drink and add it to the glass.

blanc-arita.title: Blanc-arita
blanc-arita.content: Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

blushing-betty.title: Blushing Betty
blushing-betty.content:
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

Garnish with grapefruit twist.

boulevardier.title: Boulevardier
boulevardier.intro: A close cousin of the [Negroni](/drinks/negroni/). For a more earthy variation, try substituting St. George [Bruto Americano](http://stgeorgespirits.com/spirits/bruto-americano/) for Campari.
boulevardier.content:
Stir whiskey, Campari, and vermouth with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

Garnish with orange twist or a brandied cherry.

brandy-alexander.title: Brandy Alexander
brandy-alexander.content:
Add brandy, cream, and demerara syrup to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass.

Top with grated nutmeg.

brandy-cocktail-2.title: Brandy Cocktail No. 2
ingredients: ½ oz Dry Curaçao orange liqueur
brandy-cocktail-2.content:
Stir well with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

cherry-on-top.title: Cherry on Top
cherry-on-top.content:
Muddle five cherries in the bottom of your cocktail shaker. Add the liquids and ice. Shake.

[Double strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a Collins glass filled with ice. Set a cherry atop the ice as a garnish.

cold-buttered-rum.title: Cold Buttered Rum
cold-buttered-rum.content: Combine ingredients in a shaker. Add ice and shake. Strain into an old-fashioned glass or glass mug.

daiquiri.title: Daiquiri
daiquiri.content: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.

dalmatian.title: Dalmatian
dalmatian.content: Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice.

egg-sour.title: Egg Sour

image.alt: A creamy-looking egg sour, filling a small coupe glass to the brim

egg-sour.content:
Add everything except nutmeg to a cocktail shaker. [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking); add ice and shake. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a coupe glass.

Garnish with freshly-grated nutmeg.

el-presidente.title: El Presidente
ingredients: ¾ oz curaçao or orange liqueur
el-presidente.intro: Dry vermouth can be substituited for blanc vermouth (resulting in a slightly dryer drink, naturally).
el-presidente.content: Stir all liquids with ice. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with orange twist.

elder-fashioned.title: Elder Fashioned

image.alt: A crystal-clear cocktail in a rocks glass on a bar mat. Beside it is a vegetable peeler, a grapefruit, and a cocktail shaker.

elder-fashioned.intro: The right gin is essential in this cocktail—it cannot be overly piney or too floral. Stick with Plymouth if you can. In a pinch, you can get away with Hendrick’s and its cucumber flavor. Most other gins I’ve tried have not fared as well.
elder-fashioned.content:
[Stir](/techniques/stirring/) bitters, gin, and elderflower liqueur with plenty of ice. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice.

Express oils from grapefruit twist over the glass and rub the peel around the rim. Add peel to the glass.

french-kiss.title: French Kiss

image.alt: A French Kiss in a crystal glass in front of two bottles of vermouth

french-kiss.intro: As always, use only [high quality vermouth](/ingredients/vermouth/#brands) that is [fresh](/ingredients/vermouth/#storing-vermouth).
french-kiss.content: Build in a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

gbc.title: GBC

image.alt: A refreshing-looking GBC in a crystal rocks glass

gbc.content:
Middle basil leaves, three cucumber slices, and simple syrup in the base of a rocks glass. Add the gin and lime, and crushed ice.

Top with tonic water. Garnish with slice of cucumber.

gin-and-tonic.title: Gin and Tonic

image.alt: A gin and tonic beside a bottle of Aviation gin and Fever Tree Mediterranean tonic water

gin-and-tonic.intro: A deceptively simple drink, these particular instructions are meant to minimize the amount of carbonation lost from the tonic water. Recipe by Dave Arnold.
gin-and-tonic.content:
Pre-chill a rocks glass and gin in the freezer.

Add the gin to the rocks glass. Gently pour in the tonic water.

Squeeze the juice from the lime wedge into the glass. Gently add ice; this will agitate the drink just enough to combine. Set the squeezed lime wedge atop the ice, so you can smell it as you take a sip.

indian-winter.title: Indian Winter

image.alt: Closeup photo of the cocktail in a martini glass with a star anise floating on top

indian-winter.intro:
This uses [honey syrup](/ingredients/simple-syrup/#honey-syrup) infused with cardamom pods.

Recipe found at [The Charming Detroiter](http://thecharmingdetroiter.com/indian-winter-a-cardamom-winter-cocktail/)
indian-winter.content:
Add vodka, lemon juice, syrup, and egg white to a shaker. [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking), then add ice and shake. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a coupe glass.

Add a couple drops of Angostura bitters on top of the foam (for aroma). Float the star anise atop the drink.

irish-coffee.title: Irish Coffee
ingredients: 1 oz cream, whipped until thick and frothy but still pourable

image.alt: An Irish Coffee in a decorative glass mug. It has a thick layer of cream floating atop deep brown coffee. A bottle of Tullamore Dew Irish Whiskey is behind the mug.

irish-coffee.intro:
This approach uses [burnt sugar syrup](/ingredients/burnt-sugar-syrup) instead of granulated sugar, so I take pains to warm it and the whiskey before mixing with the coffee to avoid a lukewarm drink.

Technically, any Irish whiskey will work, but you really ought to use Tullamore Dew.
irish-coffee.content:
Brew your coffee with the normal amount of grounds but half the normal amount of water so it is extra strong.

Pour hot water into the mug to pre-warm it, and into a small bowl. Add whiskey and burnt sugar syrup to a metal cocktail shaker. Place the shaker in the bowl to warm the whiskey and syrup. Do this while your coffee brews so it can sit for a couple minutes.

Pour out the hot water from the mug. Add the whiskey-syrup mixture and about 3½ oz coffee then stir briefly to combine. Then, holding a spoon just above the coffee, pour the frothed cream over the spoon so it floats atop the drink. Enjoy it while hot!

lemon-bomb.title: Lemon Bomb

image.alt: A creamy-looking yellow cocktail topped with a layer of white foam

lemon-bomb.intro: This is easier to make in batches of 2 or 4 drinks to make beating the egg whites easier, but here are the measurements for a single cocktail, which you can scale up as needed.
lemon-bomb.content:
Add aged rum, butter syrup, lemon juice, and egg yolk to a cocktail shaker. [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking), then add ice and shake again. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a coupe.

In a stand mixer, add egg white and begin beating. Add granulated sugar and white rum. Beat just until soft peaks begin to form. Spoon the foam over the top of the cocktail (some unincorporated liquid may remain at the bottom of the mixer bowl; discard it).

Garnish with lemon zest

little-bit-bittah.title: Little Bit Bittah
little-bit-bittah.content:
Shake vodka, Campari, grapefruit juice, and grenadine. Strain into rocks glass over ice.

Garnish with grapefruit wedge.

manhattan.title: Manhattan
manhattan.content:
Combine in a shaker with ice. Stir, then strain into a coupe glass.

Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

maple-bourbon-sour.title: Maple Bourbon Sour
maple-bourbon-sour.content: [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking) in a shaker without ice. Add ice and shake vigorously. [Double strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a coupe.

margarita.title: Margarita
margarita.intro: If you’re feeling extra adventurous, muddle one or two slices of jalapeño in your shaker before adding the ingredients.
margarita.content: Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

martinez.title: Martinez
martinez.intro: This is most commonly made with an old tom gin, but I prefer genever. This does not work well with a London dry gin.
martinez.content:
Stir with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Garnish with lemon twist.

martini.title: Martini
martini.intro: Everyone has an opinion about martinis, and, I’ll be honest, mine is always changing. So here’s a great starting point. You might want to omit the bitters if you're not using a juniper-forward gin.
martini.content:
Add to cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Stir well, then strain into a martini glass.

Garnish with a lemon twist.

mexico-city.title: Mexico City
mexico-city.intro: This is a fun variation on a [Manhattan](/drinks/manhattan/), with tequila in place of the whiskey. Use a high-quality tequila.
mexico-city.content:
Stir tequila, vermouth, and bitters with plenty of ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Express the oils from an orange twist over the drink, then add it and the cherry into the glass.

mimosa.title: Mimosa
mimosa.content: If someone asks you for a Mimosa, make them a [Vigo](/drinks/vigo/) instead. You’re welcome.

monkey-grass.title: Monkey Grass

image.alt: Cocktail in a coupe glass, garnished with a lime wheel. A jalapeño is on the table in front of it.

monkey-grass.intro: This is my take on a traditional Gimlet.
monkey-grass.content:
Shake gin, lime juice, and jalapeño syrup with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Garnish with a lime wheel.

negroni-sbagliato.title: Negroni Sbagliato

image.alt: Bright red drink in a champagne flute

negroni-sbagliato.content:
Stir together the Campari and sweet vermouth with ice. Strain into a champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine.

Garnish with a thin orange spiral.

negroni.title: Negroni
ingredients: 1 oz sweet vermouth (try Cocchi di Torino)
negroni.intro: The Negroni is quite sweet, but also bitter and complex. A bold, juniper-heavy gin like Tanqueray stands up to the strong flavors of Campari. An orange twist is traditional, but I like it with grapefruit a bit more.
negroni.content:
Stir with plenty of ice. Strain into a coupe glass. It can also be served over ice in a rocks glass.

Express the oils from the grapefruit peel over the drink and add it to the glass.

old-fashioned.title: Old Fashioned
old-fashioned.intro: Some will argue an Old Fashioned must be made with a sugar cube. Those people haven't tried it with burnt sugar syrup. My measurement here may seem like a lot of syrup, but burnt sugar isn’t quite as sweet as normal simple syrup, and its bitterness adds extra complexity, so I find this amount provides a good balance.
old-fashioned.content:
Build in rocks glass. Add ice and stir briefly.

Express orange peel oils over the drink, then rub it around the rim of the glass and place it in the drink.

pilots-license.title: Pilot’s License

image.alt: Closeup photo of the clear cocktail in a martini glass

pilots-license.intro: This is an unabashed response to anyone who insists a martini must be dry. Aviation is a sweeter, less juniper-heavy gin that shines with a moderately sweet blanc vermouth.
pilots-license.content:
Add to cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Stir well, then strain into a martini glass or coupe.

Garnish with a lemon twist.

pinkest-gin.title: Pinkest Gin

image.alt: Pink cocktail in a coupe glass

pinkest-gin.content: Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

red-and-black.title: Red and Black
red-and-black.content:
Combine a small amount of salt, sugar, and pepper, and rim the the edge of a collins glass with the mixture.

Muddle the strawberries in the bottom of the glass, then add ice.

Combine remaining ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into the glass.

sazerac.title: Sazerac
sazerac.content:
Chill a rocks glass in the freezer.

Pour a splash of absinthe into the glass; swirl it around to coat the inside of the glass, then pour it out.

Stir remaining liquids with plenty of ice. Strain into the rocks glass (with no ice). Express oils from lemon twist into the drink, then [discard the peel](/techniques/twist/#discarding).

shoot.title: Shoot
shoot.intro:
This is my recreation of a drink I had at the Atlanta airport. The original was made with Templeton Rye and Hennessy Cognac.

Here’s a video tutorial for [making ginger syrup](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Jx2t0DgoWc).
shoot.content:
[Stir](/techniques/stirring/) well with plenty of ice. Strain into a coupe.

This can also be served over ice in a rocks glass.

sidecar.title: Sidecar
sidecar.content:
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Express the oils from an orange twist over the drink, then [discard the peel](/techniques/twist/#discarding).

spiced-rum-milk-punch.title: Spiced Rum Milk Punch
spiced-rum-milk-punch.intro: This is typically done as a cold drink, but I’ve found it truly shines when the milk is warmed and frothed instead.
spiced-rum-milk-punch.content:
**Cold**: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

**Hot**: Put the rum, syrup, and vanilla in a metal shaker and heat it gently by placing the shaker in a bowl of hot water. Preheat a small mug with hot water. Meanwhile, heat the milk and froth it with a mixer or milk frother. Empty the mug and add the rum mixture; pour the hot milk into the rum and stir gently to combine.

Garnish with ground nutmeg and cinnamon.

tabs-vs-spaces.title: Tabs vs. Spaces
tabs-vs-spaces.intro: It’s a programmer joke. I’m a nerd.
tabs-vs-spaces.content: Add everything to a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into a coupe glass.

tarheel-tears.title: Tarheel Tears
tarheel-tears.intro: Did North Carolina lose a game? Excellent! Drink the tears of your enemy.
tarheel-tears.content:
Add ouzo, rum, cream, and syrup into a cocktail shaker with plenty of fresh ice. Shake. Strain into a coupe glass.

Garnish with the grated almond.

tequila-sour.title: Tequila Sour
tequila-sour.intro: The burnt sugar syrup is my own addition.
tequila-sour.content: [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking), then add ice and shake. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

the-conference.title: The Conference
ingredients: ¼ oz demerara syrup or simple syrup
the-conference.intro: This is like a kitchen sink of cocktails, almost like somebody couldn’t decide what they wanted in the drink, so they added a bit of everything—it even has two different twists! Yet somehow, it works out.
the-conference.content: Stir all ingredients (apart from twists) in an ice-filled shaker glass. Strain into an old fashioned glass over fresh ice. Add the orange and lemon twists.

vigo.title: Vigo
vigo.intro: I didn’t invent this drink, but I did give it the name.
vigo.content: Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake then strain into a wine glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Be disappointed by Mimosas for the rest of your life.

weekday-fizz.title: Weekday Fizz
weekday-fizz.intro: Sometimes you want the experience of a good drink, without the alcohol. Unfortunately, a good mocktail is hard to find. I’m particularly proud of this one.
weekday-fizz.content: Shake everything except tonic water with plenty of ice. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Top with tonic water.

white-lady.title: White Lady
white-lady.intro: I typically use a London dry gin for this, but nearly any type will work.
white-lady.content: [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking/#dry-shaking); add ice and shake. [Double-strain](/techniques/straining/#double-straining) into a coupe glass.

winter-margarita.title: Winter Margarita

image.alt: Two white cocktails with a frothy top in front of a bottle of mezcal and a bottle of tequila

winter-margarita.content: [Dry shake](/techniques/shaking#dry-shaking) ingredients in a shaker (no ice). Add ice and shake until well chilled. [Double strain](/techniques/straining#double-straining) into a coupe glass with a salted rim.
